DOC.brief_summary: Test bioequivalence of generic tacrolimus (Tacni), using original tacrolimus (Prograf) as comparator, in elderly (>60 yr) renal transplant recipients
DOC.brief_title: Generic Tacrolimus in the Elderly - Prograf® vs Tacni®
DOC.detailed_description: 12-hour pharmacokinetic investigations performed on each formulation in each patient at steady-state. Patients will be randomized with regards to which formulation to start with. 1-2 weeks between each PK investigation.
DOC.criteria: Renal transplant recipients that will receive Tac as part of their immunosuppressive therapy. Recipients 60 years of age or older. Signed informed consent. Diabetes mellitus (WHO criteria). Concomitant treatment with: diltiazem, verapamil, phenytoin, carbamazepin, fluconazole, ketoconazole, voriconazole, erythromycin, clarithromycin.
